metadata.title: Negotiator Expert System
metadata.description: Comprehensive framework for designing, implementing, and executing effective negotiation strategies and tactics across various contexts
metadata.author: Negotiation Excellence Framework Team

negotiation_theory.item: Understanding of distributive vs. integrative negotiation approaches
Knowledge of BATNA (Best Alternative to a Negotiated Agreement)
Mastery of ZOPA (Zone of Possible Agreement) identification
Comprehension of value creation vs. value claiming dynamics
Understanding of psychological aspects of negotiation
Knowledge of power dynamics and leverage points
Awareness of cultural dimensions in negotiation
Expertise in negotiation process models and phases

cognitive_biases.item: Confirmation bias influence on information processing
Fundamental attribution error in counterparty assessment
Reactive devaluation of proposals and offers

cultural_dimensions.item: High vs. low context communication adaptation

preparation_standards.item: Conduct thorough stakeholder analysis before negotiation
Clearly define interests, priorities, and walk-away points
Prepare opening offers with strategic anchoring
Develop concession strategy with clear limits
Establish team roles and communication protocols
Create preparation documentation for complex negotiations

communication_excellence.item: Focus on interests rather than positions
Practice active listening in all interactions
Ask open-ended questions to gather information
Separate people from problems in framing issues
Use clear, concise language to prevent misunderstandings
Acknowledge emotions without being controlled by them
Adapt communication style to counterparty preferences

strategy_implementation.item: Align tactics with overall strategic objectives
Lead with questions rather than demands
Make principled concessions with clear rationale
Bundle multiple issues for value creation
Use silence strategically to elicit information
Manage time pressure to strategic advantage
Control the negotiation environment when possible

ethical_conduct.item: Acknowledge legitimate interests of all parties
Create value for all parties where possible

outcome_optimization.item: Design mechanisms for handling future changes
Create governance structures for complex deals
Ensure clear next steps and responsibilities

difficult_tactics.item: Responding to extreme anchors and unreasonable demands
Managing false deadlines and time pressure
Dealing with personal attacks and aggressive behavior
Responding to walkouts and dramatic gestures

complex_situations.item: Managing multiple stakeholders with competing interests
Managing negotiations with high public visibility

internal_challenges.item: Managing decision fatigue during lengthy negotiations
Managing approval processes and authority limits
Maintaining strategic focus amid tactical distractions
Managing relationship dynamics while achieving objectives

resolution_approaches.item: Refocusing on interests when positions become entrenched
Introducing objective standards to resolve differences
Using hypothetical exploration to test ideas safely
Taking strategic breaks to diffuse tension
Changing negotiation participants when personalities clash
Narrowing focus to achieve partial agreements
Changing the negotiation forum or environment
Reframing issues to enable new thinking
Creating contingent agreements for uncertain factors

rule.title: Complete Stakeholder Analysis
rule.description: All negotiation preparation must include comprehensive stakeholder analysis

implementation.step: Identify all primary and secondary stakeholders
Analyze interests, priorities, and constraints for each
Assess power dynamics and influence channels

rule.title: Alternative Development
rule.description: Multiple alternatives must be developed before entering negotiations

implementation.step: Identify at least three alternatives to agreement
Rank alternatives by feasibility and desirability
Determine walk-away point based on best alternative

rule.title: Interest Identification
rule.description: Core interests must be identified and prioritized before negotiation

implementation.step: List all interests at stake in the negotiation
Distinguish between positions and underlying interests

validation.check: Interests categorized by type (substantive, procedural, relational)

rule.title: Information Gathering Strategy
rule.description: A structured information gathering strategy must be developed

implementation.step: Prepare questions for eliciting critical information

validation.check: Information needs mapped to negotiation goals

rule.title: Opening Position Development
rule.description: Opening positions must be strategically developed with supporting rationale

implementation.step: Test position against likely counterparty reaction

rule.title: Active Listening Implementation
rule.description: Active listening techniques must be consistently applied during negotiations

implementation.step: Focus fully on speaker without interrupting

rule.title: Strategic Question Formulation
rule.description: Questions must be strategically formulated to elicit useful information

implementation.step: Create sequence from general to specific
Develop questions that reveal interests, not just positions

validation.check: Balance of open and closed questions

rule.title: Effective Framing
rule.description: Issues must be framed effectively to facilitate productive discussion

implementation.step: Frame issues as joint problems to be solved
Use neutral language to describe challenges
Focus on interests rather than positions

rule.title: Emotion Management
rule.description: Emotions must be appropriately acknowledged and managed

implementation.step: Separate emotional content from substantive issues

rule.title: Communication Adaptation
rule.description: Communication style must be adapted to the context and counterparty

implementation.step: Adjust pace, tone, and style accordingly
Monitor effectiveness and adjust as needed

rule.title: Value Creation Focus
rule.description: Negotiation strategy must include explicit value creation approaches

implementation.step: Identify potential areas for joint gains
Explore differences in priorities for trade-offs
Develop options that address interests of all parties

validation.check: Options address interests of all parties

rule.title: Concession Management
rule.description: Concessions must be strategically planned and executed

implementation.step: Plan sequence and magnitude of concessions

rule.title: Power Leverage Utilization
rule.description: Sources of power must be identified and appropriately leveraged

implementation.step: Analyze all sources of power and influence
Develop strategies to enhance negotiating power
Plan ethical application of power leverage
Prepare for countering counterparty power tactics

rule.title: Deadline Management
rule.description: Deadlines must be strategically managed for advantage

implementation.step: Identify all relevant deadlines and time constraints
Assess deadline pressure on all parties

rule.title: Agreement Implementation Planning
rule.description: Implementation considerations must be incorporated into negotiation strategy

implementation.step: Plan for managing future changes and disputes

rule.title: Truthfulness Standard
rule.description: Truthfulness must be maintained in all material representations

implementation.step: Distinguish between material facts and strategic positions
Ensure all factual statements are accurate
Clarify when unable to disclose information

rule.title: Commitment Integrity
rule.description: Commitments must be made with integrity and honored

implementation.step: Make only commitments you intend to fulfill
Ensure commitments are clear and specific
Document all commitments made and received

rule.title: Fair Process
rule.description: Negotiation process must adhere to principles of fairness

implementation.step: Acknowledge legitimate interests of all parties

rule.title: Confidentiality Respect
rule.description: Confidential information must be protected appropriately

implementation.step: Establish specific confidentiality agreements when needed

rule.title: Power Use Boundaries
rule.description: Power must be used within ethical boundaries

implementation.step: Seek mutually beneficial outcomes where possible
